intro: Aspidogyne macarenae, commonly known as the Macarena aspidogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Aspidogyne macarenae is primarily found in humid, shaded forest environments at moderate elevations.
